content.en: Algorithmic Education: Researchers have explored the use of algorithms in various educational contexts. They have found that machine learning algorithms can be used to predict student academic performance, identify at-risk students, and predict attrition in higher education. Additionally, algorithms such as the stochastic EM method and the expectation-maximization algorithm provide alternative ways to estimate parameters and fit regression models in large-scale assessments. These findings highlight the potential of algorithms to improve educational research and support student success.
content.da: Algoritmisk uddannelse: Forskere har udforsket brugen af algoritmer i forskellige uddannelsesmæssige sammenhænge. De har fundet ud af, at maskinlæringsalgoritmer kan bruges til at forudsige studerendes akademiske præstationer, identificere risikostuderende og forudsige frafald i videregående uddannelser. Desuden giver algoritmer som den stokastiske EM-metode og forventningsmaksimeringsalgoritmen alternative måder at estimere parametre og tilpasse regressionsmodeller i storskalaundersøgelser. Disse fund fremhæver potentialet i algoritmer til at forbedre uddannelsesforskning og støtte studerendes succes.
